page.title: 01MOUNTAIN ASH AND ABERFAN
page.content: Mountain Ash an Aberfan are both South Wales mining communities, situated along the edges of the steep sided Cynon and Taff Valleys in long rows of terraced houses. They were developed at the latter part of the nineteenth century,with the introduction of deep mining techniques. Mountain Ash in particular is a very run down locality with high levels of unemployment,and virtually no industry in the town itself.Aberfan does however have the Taff Vale Colliery providing employment for some of the towns people. The population of both towns is about 15,000 and is tending to fall in both towns especially Mountain Ash.Both areas would be classed as working class.
